Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Sunburn \Sun"burn`\, n. The burning or discoloration produced on the skin by the heat of the sun; tan. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sunburn \Sun"burn`\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Sunburned}or {Sunburnt}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Sunburning}.] To burn or discolor by the sun; to tan. [1913 Webster]
Sunburnt and swarthy though she be. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]

sunburn n 1: a browning of the skin resulting from exposure to the rays of the sun [syn: {tan}, {suntan}, {burn}] 2: redness of the skin caused by exposure to the rays of the sun [syn: {erythema solare}] v : get a sunburn by overexposure to the sun [syn: {burn}]
